description: Here's a look at the top stories making headlines on the "CBS Evening News with Norah O'Donnell."
title: "CBS Evening News" headlines for Monday, July 8, 2024

description: From July 1 to July 7, 340 people were killed and 756 were wounded for a total of 1,096 shooting victims across the U.S., according to the Gun Violence Archive.
title: Gun violence over July 4 week dropped in 2024, but still above 2019 levels

description: There are big savings on every model of Apple AirPods to be had before Prime Day rolls around.
title: The best Apple AirPods deals ahead of Prime Day 2024

description: Starting July 15, Target will no longer accept personal checks as payment from customers, citing changing financial habits.
title: Target will soon stop accepting personal checks from customers

description: There are big savings on every model of Apple AirPods to be had before Prime Day rolls around.
title: The best Apple AirPods deals ahead of Prime Day 2024

description: Countertop ice makers are ideal for summer parties. Here are our top ice maker picks, including a viral fave.
title: The best countertop ice makers for summer 2024

description: France's latest legislative election results did not reap a clear majority win for any political party there, leaving the country without a clear choice for prime minister at this time. CBS News' Elaine Cobbe breaks down what's next in France's quest to choose new leaders.
title: What's next in France after no party wins majority in elections?

description: Google's carbon emissions increased 13% compared to 2023, according to the company's annual Environmental Report. Justine Calma, a senior science reporter with The Verge, joins CBS News with more details on how artificial intelligence may be contributing to more emissions.
title: AI demands push carbon emissions up

description: The USPS is set to hike the cost of postage for the second time this year. Here's when the new rates are taking effect.
title: The price of a "Forever" stamp is rising again – here's when

description: Aerospace company Boeing has agreed to plead guilty to a criminal fraud charge in a deal with the Justice Department. The charge stems from a pair of crashes involving 737 Max jetliners. If approved, the deal would call on Boeing to pay a $243.6 million fine and invest almost half a billion dollars in safety programs. Zach Wichter, a consumer travel reporter with USA Today, joins CBS News to discuss what we know about the deal.
title: Boeing agrees to plea deal over 737 Max crashes

description: At least one person has died and more than 2 million are without electricity after Beryl made landfall in Texas. The storm made landfall as a Category 1 hurricane, but has been downgraded to a tropical storm. CBS News Texas' Jason Allen reports from Palacios and CBS News correspondent Janet Shamlian has more from Sugar Land.
title: At least 1 dead, 2 million without power as Beryl slams Texas

description: White House press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre got into a tense back-and-forth with members of the media Monday over questions about a Parkinson's expert reportedly visiting the White House multiple times over the last year. It was not clear whether the expert was consulting about President Biden's health or not. The briefing was the third straight briefing dominated by questions on the president's health following his debate with former President Donald Trump.
title: Questions on neurologist's White House visits spark heated exchange over Biden's health

description: Outsource your cleaning duties to this affordable voice-controlled robot vacuum.
title: The bestselling robot vacuum on Amazon is 50% off

description: The Heritage Foundation's Project 2025 includes a detailed blueprint for the next Republican president to usher in a sweeping overhaul of the executive branch.
title: What is Project 2025? What to know about the conservative plan

description: CBS News foreign correspondent Holly Williams got a rare look inside Rafah, where she joined the Israel Defense Forces trying to eradicate Hamas in the southern Gaza city. This comes as efforts for a potential hostage release and cease-fire deal appear to progress and as Israel ramps up raids in Gaza City.
title: Israel ramps up Gaza City operations as images of Rafah show mass destruction

description: A Russian court on Monday convicted Zhenya Berkovich, a prominent independent theater director, and playwright Svetlana Petriychuk of terrorism charges and sentenced them to six years each in prison.
title: Russian playwright, theater director sentenced to prison on terrorism charges

description: "I don't think colleges are teaching people what they need to get a job," one skeptic of higher education said.
title: More Americans say college just isn't worth it, survey finds

description: Five congressional Democrats have publicly called for President Biden to step down from the 2024 race, and there are reports that other senior legislators may have expressed similar concerns during a call with House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries. CBS News congressional correspondent Scott MacFarlane reports from Capitol Hill.
title: Which lawmakers are calling for Biden to drop out of 2024 race?

description: The 2016 RNC platform mentioned the word "abortion" 35 times. The proposed 2024 platform mentions the word once.
title: RNC panel approves Trump-influenced 2024 GOP platform

description: President Biden is hoping to combat continued calls from several Democrats for him to drop out of the 2024 presidential race after his poor debate performance against former President Donald Trump. CBS News chief White House correspondent Nancy Cordes is following Mr. Biden's moves to quiet the criticism.
title: How Biden is fighting calls to step aside

description: Credit card debt forgiveness may not be for everyone. Here are four signs you may want to consider alternatives.
title: 4 signs credit card debt forgiveness may not work for you

description: Houston Mayor John Whitmire called on residents to shelter in place as Tropical Storm Beryl causes flooding and power outages. Whitmire said about two million people are without power in the region, including 700,000 in Houston.
title: Houston mayor provides Beryl flooding update, says 2 million without power

description: Beryl made landfall just south of Houston, Texas, as a Category 1 hurricane before weakening into a tropical storm Monday. CBS News Dallas chief meteorologist Scott Padgett breaks down the forecast for North Texas and CBS News San Francisco meteorologist Zoe Mintz has more on what's ahead for Beryl. Also, CBS news' Omar Villafranca and Janet Shamlian report from Galveston and Sugar Land, cities battered by the storm.
title: Beryl floods parts of Texas, high winds cause damage and power outages

description: President Biden addresses concerns over campaign after debate performance; Boeing accepts plea deal stemming from 737 Max crashes
title: 7/8: CBS News 24/7 Episode 2

description: Cybercriminals are using "smishing" scams to get iPhone users to reveal their Apple IDs, Symantec warns. Here's what to watch out for.
title: New cyberattack targets iPhone Apple IDs. Here's how to protect yourself.

description: For recent graduates, smaller cities can offer abundant work and more affordable housing opportunities. Here's why this city ranks No. 1.
title: These are the best and worst cities for new college grads

description: Here's our in-house consumer tech expert Jason R. Rich's in-depth review of the Amazon Kindle Scribe.
title: Amazon Kindle Scribe e-reader review: Very cool features will make you take note

description: Three administrators have been "permanently removed from their positions" at Columbia College and "remain on leave" over texts they exchanged during an on-campus event about Jewish life at the school, Columbia University's president announced Monday.
title: 3 Columbia University administrators ousted from posts over controversial texts

description: "That's how we get apex predators," one expert at the Long Island Aquarium told CBS News. "The strongest will survive."
title: These cannibal baby sharks eat their siblings in the womb

description: Inflation could influence the price of gold, but it's not the only factor. Here's what to consider.
title: What will happen to the price of gold if inflation hits 2%?

description: President Biden has been working to address concerns, especially among Democrats in Congress, about his ability to serve another term after his poor debate performance.
title: Here are the Democratic lawmakers calling for Biden to step aside in the 2024 race

description: Baby sand tiger sharks fight to the death before they're even born. Here's what to know about intrauterine cannibalism.
title: These cannibal baby sharks eat their siblings in the womb

description: A 150 million-year-old dinosaur skeleton found in Wyoming is on display in Denmark – after briefly being lost in transit.
title: Huge dinosaur skeleton unearthed in Wyoming makes it to museum in Europe

description: The Federal Reserve is expected to cut rates. Here are a few financial moves to make and mistakes to avoid first.
title: 3 things to do (and 3 things to avoid) before interest rates are cut

description: The State Department has urged Americans not to travel to Israel and the West Bank.
title: American citizen working for drone company injured in Israel

description: Hurricane Beryl makes landfall in eastern Texas; Four senior House Democrats say Biden should end presidential run.
title: 7/8: CBS News 24/7 Episode 1

description: Jay Johnston, who also starred in "Bob's Burgers," faces a maximum sentence of five years in prison after pleading guilty to civil disorder.
title: "Anchorman" actor pleads guilty in Jan. 6 Capitol attack

description: One reason for the record volume might be that flight prices dipped slightly during the holiday weekend.
title: Record 3 million passengers passed through TSA checkpoints on Sunday

description: With more Israelis calling for a cease-fire deal in the war against Hamas in Gaza, CBS News traveled with the IDF into Rafah, where Israel recently carried out a widely criticized ground offensive. CBS News senior foreign correspondent Holly Williams has more.
title: Israeli forces take CBS News inside Rafah, respond to condemnation over actions in Gaza

description: Dangerous heat across the U.S. has affected millions of people, with electric bills expected to increase 7.9% this summer as America fights to keep cool.
title: Dangerous heat waves across U.S. affecting millions

description: Wells Fargo recently fired over a dozen employees for allegedly faking keyboard activity in an attempt to appear busy at work, according to a report from Bloomberg News. In light of that, Sanvi Bangalore, editorial intern with The Wall Street Journal, joined CBS News to discuss some of the tracking tools companies are now using to monitor their employees' productivity.
title: Inside the productivity-tracking tools companies use for remote workers

description: France's political future is in limbo after no party came away with a majority in the snap elections called by President Emmanuel Macron. CBS News correspondent Elaine Cobbe has more.
title: France in political deadlock, no party wins majority in elections

description: Russia launched a barrage of missiles against multiple Ukrainian cities Monday in a rare daytime attack that hit the main children's hospital in the capital city, Kyiv. CBS News senior foreign correspondent Elizabeth Palmer has the latest.
title: What we know about Russia's brazen daytime missile strike on Ukraine's capital

description: Beryl has knocked out power for over 1 million customers after coming ashore in Texas as a Category 1 hurricane, according to tracking site PowerOutage.us, and the number is expected to rise. Storm surge is expected to be the greatest threat from the storm. CBS News correspondent Omar Villafranca has more on the situation in Texas and CBS News Philadelphia meteorologist Kate Bilo has a look at Beryl's forecast.
title: 1 million without power as Beryl tracks through Texas

description: The pair may be the first of their kind, but several other family members have played in the NBA together, even on the same team. Here are some of the other famous duos of the league.
title: LeBron and Bronny James and other famous NBA family members

description: Home equity loan interest rates should fall this year — but when and by how much? Here's what to know.
title: Here's how a 2024 Fed rate cut will affect home equity loans

description: Ian Cleary, 31, of Saratoga, California, was detained in April in the city of Metz in northeastern France after a three-year search.
title: American detained after "So I raped you" message can be extradited

description: A huge dinosaur skeleton "sort of disappeared" during its transatlantic journey from the U.S. to a museum in Denmark, but as CBS News' Leah Mishkin reports, the 150-million-year-old Camarasaurus Grandis finally made it to its new home.
title: Dinosaur skeleton found in U.S. finally finds new home in Europe

description: Paramount Global, the owner of CBS News, has made a multibillion-dollar deal to merge with the film production company Skydance Media. To make that possible, Skydance is buying another company, National Amusements, controlled by Shari Redstone, which owns the largest share of Paramount Global.
title: Paramount Global, owner of CBS News, to merge with Skydance Media

description: Walmart's rival Amazon Prime Day sale, Walmart Deals, starts today. Here's everything you need to know to save big.
title: Walmart Deals live blog: Best deals from the rival Prime Day sale

description: Gold could boost your investment portfolio this July - especially if you make these three moves.
title: 3 gold investing moves to boost your portfolio this July

description: Students from families earning less than $300,000 won't have to pay any tuition to attend medical school.
title: $1 billion donation will make Johns Hopkins medical school free for most

description: The new inflation report will be released on July 11. Here are three CD account types to consider before then.
title: 3 CD account types to consider before the July inflation report

description: Workers set to strike at Paris airports that will be the main gateway into France for Olympic athletes and visitors.
title: French airport worker unions call for strike just before Paris Olympics

description: President Biden on Monday sent a letter to Democrats in Congress stating again that he would not be dropping out of the 2024 race for the White House, despite the growing number of lawmakers calling on him to drop out. Biden has been on his heels since his debate performance against former President Donald Trump sparked concerns about his fitness for office. CBS News chief White House correspondent Nancy Cordes has more.
title: Biden tells congressional Democrats he's "firmly committed" to staying in race

description: Members of the Coast Guard rescued five men on Sunday after their vessel collapsed off the coast of Jacksonville, Florida.
title: Coast Guard rescues 5 men after boat capsizes off Florida coast

description: For 10 months, students at Tulane University worked to design and build a tiny home for a member of their community in need. The home is just 440 square feet, but its impact is immeasurable.
title: Tulane University students design, build tiny home for man in need

description: Lawmakers are returning to Capitol Hill for the first time since President Biden's debate against former President Donald Trump. Mr. Biden vows to continue his 2024 campaign as more Democrats call on him to drop out. CBS News congressional correspondent Nikole Killion has more on Biden's defiance against those calls and a push for the invocation of the 25th Amendment from a GOP House member.
title: Congress, Biden at odds over reelection run

description: Actor and filmmaker Rashida Jones, best known for her roles in the popular TV shows "The Office" and "Parks and Recreation," talks about her new project "Sunny" and taking on a different genre in the mystery thriller.
title: Actor Rashida Jones talks taking on mystery thriller drama "Sunny"

description: Waning support for President Biden's reelection campaign among Democrats is likely to come to a head this week as more congressional members voice their concerns about the president's prospects against former President Donald Trump in November. Biden, for his part, remains defiantly committed to staying in the race. CBS News chief White House correspondent Nancy Cordes has the latest.
title: Critical week for Biden with more Democrats calling for him to drop out of 2024 race

description: Hurricane Beryl has made landfall south of Houston, Texas, as a Category 1 storm, bringing dangerous winds and storm surge. CBS News Texas reporter Jason Allen has more on the conditions in Texas and Weather Channel meteorologist Jim Cantore has a look at the Beryl's path as it tracks across the United States.
title: Here's where Hurricane Beryl is headed next after hitting Texas coast

description: Reformist candidate Masoud Pezeshkian will be Iran's new president after topping hard-liner Saeed Jalili in this weekend's runoff election marked by low voter turnout. CBS News senior foreign correspondent Elizabeth Palmer has more.
title: Inside reformist Masoud Pezeshkian's Iranian presidential election win

description: From heart disease​ monitoring to post-surgery recovery, here's why some doctors are recommending the use of smart wearables like the Apple watch.​
title: Why some doctors are recommending Apple Watches

description: The 2024 Olympics in Paris will be the first time the U.S. men are in the Olympic soccer tournament since 2008.
title: U.S. men's Olympic soccer team announced. Here's who made the cut.

description: The remains of more than 440 people have been unearthed so far in a case that has been dubbed the "Shakahola forest massacre."
title: Doomsday cult leader goes on trial after over 400 followers die

description: Enjoy Quaker Oats in the hot summer months with these quick and easy overnight oats recipes featured on "CBS Mornings." Save time and energy by making a large batch and putting them in the fridge to indulge throughout the week. Find more delicious recipes — hot, cold, sweet or savory — on QuakerOats.com. (Disclaimer: This segment was sponsored by Quaker Oats).
title: Easy and delicious overnight oats recipes to try this summer

description: Professional diver Paul De Gelder started advocating for shark conservation after he was attacked by a bull shark in 2009 in Sydney, Australia. For this year's "Shark Week" on the Discovery Channel, he traveled to the scenes of shark bites, including his own.
title: Professional diver Paul De Gelder talks about visiting sites of shark attacks for "Shark Week"

description: Hurricane Beryl, which made landfall in Texas on Monday morning, is causing travel impacts on what was expected to be another busy day for airlines. Overnight, United, American Airlines and Southwest canceled dozens of flights in Houston and other cities because of the storm.
title: Hurricane Beryl impacts travelers returning from holiday weekend

description: The 2024 French election results were no big win for far-right, but the next steps are unclear. Here's what could happen.
title: Here's what could happen next after France's national election

description: Architecture students at Tulane University designed, created and built a permanent home for a man who hasn't had one for nearly two decades. The students worked on the project for 10 months as part of their final assignment for the UrbanBuild program at Tulane.
title: Tulane students build tiny home for man who has been homeless for nearly two decades

description: President Biden wrote that he "wouldn't be running again if I did not absolutely believe I was the best person to beat Donald Trump in 2024."
title: Biden tells congressional Democrats he is "firmly committed" to staying in 2024 race

description: Some doctors are telling their patients to get an Apple Watch, which is not a medical device, to help diagnose and manage certain health conditions, as researchers look into how to use the devices for monitoring heart disease and post-surgery recovery, according to the Wall Street Journal. Dr. Rod Passman, professor of medicine at Northwestern Medicine, joined CBS News to talk about some of the possible benefits.
title: Some doctors recommending Apple Watches to manage health conditions

description: With fewer than four months until the election, it's not just the national races that are drawing harassment, intimidation and threats, but local candidates as well. Harassment of local officials, both Democrats and Republicans, has increased by 55% over the past two years, according to a new study.
title: Candidates in local elections across the country face intimidation, harassment

description: New cease-fire talks are scheduled to begin this week in the war between Israel and Hamas. Last week, for the first time, Israel's military took foreign journalists into the city of Rafah. Israel says it had to go into the city near the border with Egypt because Hamas's four remaining battalions were hiding there. Israel's military claims it's killed more than 900 militants in the city; however, it's also killed civilians.
title: A look inside Gaza as cease-fire talks to resume in the 9-month war between Israel and Hamas

description: A right-wing political party was expected to take control of the French legislature, but instead a left-wing coalition won the largest share of seats, exit polls projected. However, it is not enough to take control. President Emmanuel Macron's centrist alliance came in second.
title: French election to leave its parliament in a deadlock

description: Hurricane Beryl made landfall between Galveston and Corpus Christi, Texas, on Monday. The dangerous Category 1 storm brings torrential rain, winds up to 80 mph and storm surge up to 7 feet high.
title: Hurricane Beryl makes landfall in Texas as a Category 1 storm

description: More House Democrats came out over the weekend to urge President Biden to leave the race, both publicly and during a call of leading Democrats. However, at campaign events in Philadelphia and Harrisburg, the president insisted he is not going anywhere.
title: Biden faces mounting pressure to drop out of presidential race

description: California is one of the western states dealing with a historic heat wave as at least 21 wildfires burn, forcing evacuations in parts of the state. Multiple heat records were broken over the weekend. Death Valley, one of the hottest places on Earth, hit 129 degrees on Sunday, tying the 2007 record.
title: At least 21 wildfires burn in California amid historic heat wave

description: Hurricane Beryl slams into Texas after strengthening overnight. Also, a deadly record-breaking heat wave continues to bake millions and fuels dangerous wildfires out West. All that and all that matters in today's Eye Opener.
title: Eye Opener: After strengthening overnight, Hurricane Beryl slams into Texas

description: Hurricane Beryl has come ashore in Texas about 70 miles south of Houston as a Category 1 storm with damaging winds and life-threatening storm surge, the National Hurricane Center said. CBS News correspondent Janet Shamlian has more.
title: Beryl makes landfall in Texas as Category 1 hurricane

description: Airlines are suspending or canceling flights into Houston as Hurricane Beryl makes landfall in Texas.
title: Beryl snarls U.S. travel as airlines scrap more than 1,300 flights

description: With Jessica Springsteen not returning to Team USA's equestrian jumping team, here's who made the cut.
title: Jessica Springsteen, Bruce's daughter, not going to Paris Olympics

description: At least 20 people were killed and Kyiv's main children's hospital was damaged Monday in a Russian attack that saw a barrage of missiles fired at Ukraine's capital and other cities. BBC News correspondent Abdujalil Abdurasulov joined CBS News with more.
title: At least 20 killed in rare daytime Russian attack on Ukraine's capitol and other cities

description: Amazon shoppers can get two months of Audible for free, while Prime members can score three free months. Here's how.
title: Get up to 3 free months of Audible ahead of Amazon Prime Day

description: Residents fed up with the impact of mass tourism in Barcelona have staged a mass demonstration, harassing visitors in the Spanish city.
title: Spanish anti-tourism protesters harass foreign visitors in Barcelona

description: The 36-year-old went missing after she went to buy medicine for her sick child, police said, prompting relatives to launch a search.
title: Another woman swallowed whole by a python in Indonesia

description: The Roman-era Antikythera shipwreck was originally discovered in the Aegean Sea by sponge divers over a century ago.
title: Divers exploring ancient shipwreck find new treasures and a second wreck

description: Daniel Paduchowski called Flagstaff police, saying his wife never returned after leaving to go for a run and a swim, authorities said
title: Man leads authorities to missing wife's body, pleads guilty to murder

description: This is your ultimate guide to watching the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris, including how to watch without cable.
title: How to watch the 2024 Summer Olympics

description: Mark your calendars for Amazon's biggest sales event of the year, Amazon Prime Day 2024, coming this July.
title: Prime Day 2024 is coming on July 16-17: Here's everything you need to know

description: Ukrainian officials say at least 20 people were killed and a children's hospital seriously damaged in a massive Russian missile attack.
title: Ukraine says Russian missiles kill at least 20, hit children's hospital

description: Ahead of a potentially pivotal week on Capitol Hill, the Biden-Harris campaign is stepping up its contacts with lawmakers amid growing calls for the president to step down from the Democratic ticket.
title: Biden campaign ramping up outreach to lawmakers

description: Amazon Prime Day isn't the only game in town. Walmart Deals is offering big savings before Prime Day.
title: 9 best deals at Walmart's rival Amazon Prime Day sale today

description: Boeing and the Justice Department say the aerospace giant will plead guilty to criminal fraud involving two crashes of 737 Max jetliners that killed 346 people.
title: Boeing accepts plea deal stemming from 737 Max crashes

description: Paramount Global, the owner of Paramount Pictures and CBS, will merge with a media company founded by David Ellison.
title: Paramount Global to merge with Skydance Media

description: Some Texans evacuate as Beryl heads toward coast; Dancing Brooklyn crossing guard brings smiles, safety to kids
title: 7/7: CBS Weekend News

description: Michael Jackson's former home, Neverland Ranch, sits within the zone under an evacuation order as the 16,000+ Lake Fire continues to rage in Santa Barbara County on Sunday.
title: Michael Jackson's Neverland Ranch in path of 16,000 acre fire burning in Santa Barbara County

description:
First, a report on 3D printing homes on Earth, someday the moon. Then, a look at AI’s
role in mental health treatments.
title: 7/7/2024: 3D Printing; Your Chatbot Will See You Now

description:
First, new Havana Syndrome evidence revealed. Then, Kevin Hart: The 60 Minutes
Interview.
title: 7/7/2024: Targeting Americans; Kevin Hart

description: A motorcyclist died from heat exposure while visiting Death Valley National Park as the temperature there reached 128 degrees this weekend.
title: 1 dead, records shattered as heat wave continues throughout U.S.
